summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from July 2021 between FBI agents and others coordinating a meeting to discuss evidence in the Epstein case, specifically requesting chains of custody for items labeled 'IBs' (likely evidence items). The emails involve scheduling a video teleconference (VTC) meeting and ensuring physical evidence (message pads) is available.

persons.name: Liam
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient or participant in email coordination for a meeting regarding evidence chains of custody. Appears to be an FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office working on Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking.

events.title: Scheduled VTC Meeting on Evidence
events.description: A video teleconference (VTC) meeting is scheduled for 9:30am to discuss evidence, specifically the chains of custody for items labeled 'IBs'. The meeting involves coordination with the local FBI office.

keyFacts: The emails are focused on scheduling a meeting to discuss evidence chains of custody for items labeled 'IBs' in the Epstein investigation.
Multiple chain-of-custody documents (MM_1B1 through MM_IB10) are attached to one of the emails, indicating detailed evidence tracking.
The correspondence involves FBI personnel from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, highlighting the ongoing investigative activity in July 2021.
The meeting is planned as a video teleconference (VTC), with coordination through a local FBI office for technical setup.
Physical evidence, specifically 'message pads', is requested to be available for the WebEx meeting.
